result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: State's Notice of Intent to Introduce Expert Testimony
Notice of Intent to Introduce Recorded Statements.
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken and to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Fingerprinting hours are Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays, 9:00 A.M. - 11:00 A.M. or between 1:00 P.M. - 4:00 P.M.  DNA hours are Monday through Friday between 9:00 A.M. - 11:30 A.M. Do not drive at all with the exception of to and from work, court, and attorney visits.

2:54 PM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David Lee Meyers in court.  Attorney Robert William Keller in court for David Lee Meyers. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
